intro: Hieracium rhodanicum, commonly known as the red hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its bright yellow to orange flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium rhodanicum is a perennial herb that can spread through rhizomes, forming dense colonies in suitable habitats.
